intro: Craniotome mauritianum, commonly known as the Mauritius craniotome, is a unique plant endemic to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, which are typically found at the ends of branches. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories, and is adapted to the specific climate of the island. Due to its restricted habitat and potential threats from habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
